main event: A long silver needle-nosed object was observed by a civilian for 15 minutes on November 24, 1959 near Blue Hill, Maine.
interesting points: The object was on a southerly course at 3,000 ft.
The report concludes that the observations were likely military aircraft using tactics disclosed as part of the Cold War strategic planning.
An F-102 military aircraft was later sighted at 17,500 feet, allegedly observing an AEC civilian aircraft at 3,000 feet.
The pilot who initially reported the object later reassessed his report, stating it was a mistaken sighting.
The sighting was investigated by Project Blue Book and eventually deemed an unidentified flying object.
